Classical.Structure: A complex network of cells (e.g., lymphocytes, macrophages), tissues (lymph nodes, spleen, thymus), and organs that work together to defend the body against pathogens.
Classical.Function: Identifies and neutralizes 'non-self' entities (viruses, bacteria, parasites). Also performs surveillance and removes damaged or aberrant 'self' cells (e.g., cancer).
Classical.Pathology: Autoimmune disease (e.g., rheumatoid arthritis), immunodeficiency (e.g., AIDS), allergies, chronic inflammation.

SCPN.L2_NeurochemicalNeurological: The 'Neuro-Immune Axis'. This system communicates extensively via L2 signals (cytokines, chemokines), which are interpreted by the CNS (e.g., D3.Brainstem.NTS) and D3.VagusNerve. (Ref: Paper 2)
SCPN.L3_GenomicEpigeneticMorphogenetic: Performs 'morphogenetic repair' by clearing debris and damaged cells, allowing L3 regrowth. V(D)J recombination is a genomic process for antibody generation.
SCPN.L4_CellularTissueSynchronisation: Chronic inflammation (a failed L4 synchrony) and 'cytokine storms' represent a pathological, runaway L4 oscillatory state.
SCPN.L5_OrganismalPsychoemotional: The primary generator of the L5 'sickness behavior' qualia (malaise, fatigue, social withdrawal). This system's state *is* a major component of the L5 'felt-sense'. (Ref: Paper 5)
SCPN.L6_NarrativeSelf: This system *is* the biological definition of 'Self' and 'Other'. Its logic is a direct parallel to the L6 psychological 'Self-Model'.
SCPN.L9_MemoryHolograph: Possesses immunological 'memory' (B-cells, T-cells), a form of L9 information storage encoded in cellular populations.
SCPN.L16_MetaCybernetic: This system *is* the L16 'I=Model(I)' loop at the cellular level. It constantly runs a predictive model ('is this cell self?') and acts on prediction errors ('this is non-self, destroy'). Autoimmunity is a failed L16 prediction. (Ref: Paper 5)

Symbolic.MetaphysicalMapping: The 'body's ego' structure. The mechanism that defines the boundary between 'I' (self) and 'not-I' (other).

Falsification_Hypotheses: H1 (L5 Sickness Qualia): A subject is administered a peripheral L2 inflammatory agent (e.g., LPS), but their D3.VagusNerve is blocked. The subject will *fail* to report the L5 'qualia of sickness' (malaise, fatigue). This would confirm the L2(cytokine)->L5(qualia) signal is mediated by the Vagus Nerve.

H2 (L16 Cellular Model): A subject develops an autoimmune disease. This will *fail* to correlate with a corresponding 'prediction error' signal in the *central* L16 cybernetic loop (e.g., no matching DMN/ACC activity). This would falsify the hypothesis that the cellular L16 and central L16 loops are coupled.

H3 (L9 Memory): A 'memory' T-cell will be shown to be *incapable* of holding its L9 'pathogen-memory' *without* periodic L4/L2 'refresh' signals from its environment. This would falsify the L9 'static memory' (holographic) hypothesis in favor of a purely dynamic (L4) memory.
Experimental_Protocols: Ref: Paper 17, Protocol 17.E (LPS-Vagotomy Sickness Qualia Study)
